text: Assaf Khalifa (; born 1968) is a Syrian former footballer who played as a forward. ==Club career== Khalifa was the first foreign player from outside the former USSR in the Russian Football Premier League when he joined FC Zhemchuzhina Sochi in 1994. ==Managerial career== After retirement as a player, he went to coaching in Syria: Al-Nidal SC and Al-Wahda SC, Lebanon: Al-Mabarrah, Salam Zgharta and Al Nabi Sheet, Jordan: That Ras Club, and Oman: Oman Club. ==Honours== === Individual === Performances * Lebanese Premier League top goalscorer: 1995–96 ==References== Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Syrian footballers Category:Al-Wahda SC (Syria) players Category:CS Sfaxien players Category:FC Zhemchuzhina Sochi players Category:Syrian expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Russia Category:Russian Premier League players Category:Nejmeh SC players Category:Expatriate footballers in Lebanon Category:Association football forwards Category:Expatriate football managers in Jordan Category:Expatriate football managers in Lebanon Category:Expatriate football managers in Oman Category:Syrian football managers Category:Syrian expatriate sportspeople in Lebanon Category:Lebanese Premier League players Category:Syrian Premier League players Category:Lebanese Premier League managers Category:Al Mabarra Club managers Category:Salam Zgharta FC managers Category:Al Nabi Chit SC managers Category:Lebanese Premier League top scorers
title: Assaf Khalifa
